# Arpeggio: Dominant 7#5 in F# (Shape: C)

## Description
The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio in F# is a set of notes that create a distinct and colorful sound. It is often used in jazz, fusion, and other genres to add tension and complexity to chord progressions. The arpeggio consists of the root (F#), major third (A#), augmented fifth (Cx), and minor seventh (E) of the F# dominant 7#5 chord. This combination of notes gives the arpeggio a unique and somewhat dissonant quality that can be used to create tension and resolution in musical passages.

## Notes and Intervals
- **Root (F#)**: The starting note of the arpeggio, providing the tonal center.
- **Major Third (A#)**: A note that creates a major sound in relation to the root.
- **Augmented Fifth (Cx)**: An augmented or sharp fifth that adds tension to the arpeggio.
- **Minor Seventh (E)**: A note that contributes to the dominant 7 sound of the arpeggio.

## Musical Flavor
The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio in F# has a spicy and dissonant flavor that can be used to bring a sense of tension and excitement to a musical piece. Its augmented fifth (Cx) adds a unique and unexpected color to the sound, making it a popular choice for musicians looking to spice up their solos and improvisations. When played in the context of a chord progression, this arpeggio can create a sense of harmonic interest and push the boundaries of traditional tonalities.
